subtests.name: URL: Setting <a://example.net>.protocol = '' The empty string is not a valid scheme. Setter leaves the URL unchanged.
URL: Setting <a://example.net>.protocol = 'B' Upper-case ASCII is lower-cased
URL: Setting <a://example.net>.protocol = 'b,c' Only some punctuation is acceptable
URL: Setting <http://test@example.net>.protocol = 'file' Can’t switch from URL containing username/password/port to file
URL: Setting <http://example.net>.protocol = 'b' Can’t switch from special scheme to non-special
URL: Setting <ssh://me@example.net>.protocol = 'http' Can’t switch from non-special scheme to special
URL: Setting <http://example.net>.protocol = 'https:foo : bar' Stuff after the first ':' is ignored
URL: Setting Test>.protocol = 'view-source+data:foo : bar' Stuff after the first ':' is ignored
URL: Setting <http://foo.com:443/>.protocol = 'https' Port is set to null if it is the default for new scheme.

URL: Setting <http://test/>.protocol = 'h
tt	ps' Tab and newline are stripped
URL: Setting <http://test/>.protocol = 'https�' Non-tab/newline C0 controls result in no-op
URL: Setting <unix:/run/foo.socket>.username = 'me' No host means no username

URL: Setting <http://example.net>.username = '�	
 !"#$%&'()*+,-./09:;<=>?@AZ[\]^_`az{|}~Éé' UTF-8 percent encoding with the userinfo encode set.
URL: Setting <http://example.net>.username = '%c3%89té' Bytes already percent-encoded are left as-is.
URL: Setting <unix:/run/foo.socket>.password = 'secret' No host means no password

URL: Setting <http://example.net>.password = '%c3%89té' Bytes already percent-encoded are left as-is.
